title: netlib-lapack does not pull in external blas library properly
body:
spack install netlib-lapack +external-blas %xl_r@13.1.6 ^ibm-essl@5.5

When compiling with an external BLAS library such as ESSL, netlib-lapack does not pull in the proper externally defined BLAS library.  If you comment out the following lines in netlib-lapack, it works fine:

    # provides('blas', when='~external-blas') 

    # @property                                                                                                                                                                                           
    # def blas_libs(self):                                                                                                                                                                                
    #     shared = True if '+shared' in self.spec else False                                                                                                                                              
    #     return find_libraries(                                                                                                                                                                          
    #         'libblas', root=self.prefix, shared=shared, recurse=True                                                                                                                                    
    #     )        

Is there a way to make the property predicated on the variant.  Note that if you just comment out the blas_libs definition it still fails to properly find spec['blas'].
